Class SubstitutionCipher

java.lang.Object
SubstitutionCipher
public class SubstitutionCipher extends Object
A simple Security.SubstitutionCipher takes a message, and substitutes each letter in for another letter in the alphabet.

  • Constructor Details

  • Method Details

    • encrypt

      public static String encrypt(String str, String mapTo, String mapFrom)
      Encrypts using a substitution. MapTo is the substitution key, meaning what every character should mapTo (A (from) -> x (to)). mapFrom is the default order of the character. Technically, it could be any order, but the most common one is A-Za-z0-9.?() represented in BASE
      Parameters:
      str - message to encode
      mapTo - the mapping to map the message character order to
      mapFrom - the mapping that is the base order
      Returns:
      an encrypted string

    • encrypt

      public static String encrypt(String str, String mapTo)
      The common default case of substitution in which the new mapping is changing the order of characters from a traditional alphabet order. A-Za-z0-9 uses BASE to represented the traditional alphabet order
      Parameters:
      str - the message to encrypt
      mapTo - the substitution key - new 'order of the alphabet'
      Returns:
      an encrypted string

    • decrypt

      public static String decrypt(String str, String mapFrom)
      Decrypts using the common default case / order of the alphabet A-Za-z0-9
      Parameters:
      str - the string to decrypt
      mapFrom - the encryption key (i.e different order of the alphabet)
      Returns:
      a decrypted string.

    • decrypt

      public static String decrypt(String str, String mapFrom, String mapTo)
      Decryption is simply calling encryption of two alphabets (but with different orders), and swapping which one is the base and foundation. This method calls encryption by swapping that order
      Parameters:
      str - the string to decrypt
      mapFrom - the alphabet ordering used for encryption
      mapTo - the original order of the alphabet
      Returns:
      the decrypted string

    • getRandomSequence

      public static String getRandomSequence()
      Calls #getRandomSequence(String) with the BASE final variable
      Returns:
      return a random order of the BASE String

    • getRandomSequence

      public static String getRandomSequence(String str)
      Randomly samples the string, returning a string of the same length but with the characters in a different order. For example 
           getRandomSequence("abc");

     could return
     bca
     cba
     bac
     cab
     abc (very unlikely but possible)
      Code inspired by - https://www.journaldev.com/32661/shuffle-array-java
      Parameters:
      str - The string you wish to randomize the character order
      Returns:
      a new string with characters in a different random order
